item.title: Choosing Metrics
item.author: mycaptainmy@gmail.com (Yuan Meng)
item.description: ‘Tis the college and job application season of the year. If only schools and companies have crystal balls to see into each candidate’s future achievements, they need not interview people; since they do not have such things, SAT scores, GPA, internships, and other quantifiable metrics are used to aid decisions. Simplified metrics are by no means ideal â€” As Goodhart put it (often paraphrased), “When a measure becomes a metric, it ceases to be a good measure.” However, the opposite is worse: Making critical decisions based on heuristics, biases, and personal opinions.
